column1: The '''"Hobbit Dinner" in Rotterdam''' refers to an event in which [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] participated on [[28 March]] [[1958]]. Tolkien had been invited to [[Wikipedia:Rotterdam|Rotterdam]] for a "Hobbit Dinner" by his Dutch publisher Het Spectrum and the bookseller Voorhoeve & Dietrich.<ref name=Huff>{{webcite|author=Noble Smith|articleurl=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/noble-smith/jrr-tolkien-reveals-the-t_b_5373529.html|articlename=J.R.R. Tolkien Reveals TRUE Meaning Of ‘The Lord Of The Rings’ In Unearthed Audio Recording|dated=22 May 2014|website=[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/ huffingtonpost.com]|accessed=21 December 2016}}</ref><ref name=Rene/>
The dinner was held at an assembly hall
column3: part of a building called the Twaalf Provinciën Huis
column4: that no longer exists. Author [[Wikipedia:Hella Haasse|Hella Haasse]] was one of the guests at the large dinner.<ref name=Rene>[[René van Rossenberg]]
column5: "Tolkien’s Exceptional Visit to Holland: A Reconstruction"
column6: in the ''[[Proceedings of the J.R.R. Tolkien Centenary Conference]]''</ref>

column1: Tolkien delivered his speech in English
column2: Dutch and Elvish. He included the finishing statement: “[...] ''that it is now exactly twenty years since I began in earnest to complete the history of our renowned hobbit-ancestors of the Third Age. I look East
column6: and I do not see Sauron; but I see that Saruman has many descendants. We Hobbits have against them no magic weapons. Yet
column8: I give you this toast: To the Hobbits. May they outlast the Sarumans and see spring again in the trees.''”<ref name=Bio>{{HM|Bio}}</ref>

column2: an audio recording of the speech was discovered by [[René van Rossenberg]]. An excerpt of the recording was released in [[2014]].<ref name=Huff/>
